intro: Cyphostemma fugosioides, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by distinctive, inflated fruit capsules. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and unique morphology, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
